meanings.definition: A device or tool used to separate things.
meanings.sent1: The separator in the kitchen drawer keeps the forks and spoons apart.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a separator to divide the oil from the water in the engine.
meanings.sent3: The separator at the party made sure the kids didn't mix up their toys.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality acted as a separator between the two arguing friends.
meanings.sent5: The bright red separator in the toolbox made it easy to find the right screwdriver.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that separates.
meanings.sent1: The separator between the two houses was a tall fence.
meanings.sent2: The mediator acted as a separator to resolve the conflict peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The separator in the game ensured fair play among the competitors.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range acted as a natural separator between the two countries.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher was seen as a separator by the students due to her high expectations.

meanings.definition: A punctuation mark used to separate items in a list.
meanings.sent1: In the shopping list, the separator between milk, eggs, and bread was a comma.
meanings.sent2: Remember to use a separator between each item when writing a list.
meanings.sent3: The clever use of a separator in the sentence made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent4: The pause in her speech acted as a separator, emphasizing each point she made.
meanings.sent5: The separator in the recipe made it clear where one ingredient ended and the next began.
